page.title: 14Smarden Village Hall
page.content: Built in 1967, the hall is the centre of social life in Smarden. A pleasant one-storey wooden building, it stands in a large car park and has a hall, committee room and lounge with a licensed bar. It is used for meetings, elections, the surgery, dinners, dances & parties. Plays and concerts are staged here and all age groups enjoy its amenities. Social life has improved vastly since the hall opened, as formerly the school doubled uneasily as the social centre. Delegates from local organisations and elected members form the trustees who manage the hall. Luckily Smarden has many dedicated volunteers who take on the day to day running of the hall. However, rising expenses and the high cost of entertainment threaten the hall's viability. Its success is vital to social life in Smarden.
